item.title: Bob Love, Rugged, High-Scoring All-Star for Chicago Bulls, Dies at 81
item.description: Love was a cornerstone of the franchise’s success in the early 1970s. He struggled with a stutter that he overcame only after his playing days were ov...

item.title: Ukraine Fired U.S.-Made Missiles Into Russia for First Time, Officials Say
item.description: The attack came just days after President Biden gave Ukraine permission to use the weapons to strike targets inside Russia.

item.title: Putin Lowers Nuclear Weapons Threshold After U.S. Allows Ukraine to Use Missiles Against Russia
item.description: A decree signed by the Russian leader, though long-planned, came days after President Biden authorized the use of U.S.-supplied long-range missiles by...

item.title: As Pelicot Rape Trial Nears End in France, Wife Speaks of ‘Banality’
item.description: Gisèle Pelicot made her final address to the court, calling the things her husband allegedly did to her ‘unforgivable.’

item.title: What a School Performance Shows Us About Japanese Education
item.description: A look into the Japanese educational system’s delicate balancing of teamwork, discipline and personal growth.
